parts:
OpenAI‚Äôs GPT Actions, which enabled Custom GPTs to interact with external APIs via OpenAPI schemas, were deprecated in early 2024. This feature allowed developers to define API endpoints, parameters, and authentication methods, enabling GPTs to perform tasks like data retrieval and workflow automation. However, due to complexities in setup and maintenance, OpenAI has shifted focus to more robust solutions like function calling and the Assistants API . 

Understanding GPT Actions

GPT Actions allowed Custom GPTs to make API calls by importing OpenAPI schemas (versions 3.0 or 3.1). Developers could specify endpoints, request/response structures, and authentication details, enabling GPTs to perform actions such as fetching data or triggering workflows .()

Alternatives Post-Deprecation

With the deprecation of GPT Actions, developers have several alternatives:
	‚Ä¢	Function Calling: OpenAI‚Äôs function calling feature allows GPTs to call functions defined by developers, facilitating structured outputs and integrations.()
	‚Ä¢	Assistants API: This API provides tools for building AI assistants with persistent memory and the ability to call functions, offering a more comprehensive solution for complex tasks.()
	‚Ä¢	Third-Party Platforms: Platforms like Lindy offer AI agents capable of multi-step workflows, memory retention, and integrations with tools like Gmail, Slack, and Salesforce . 

Resources for Building Custom Integrations

For developers interested in building custom integrations:
	‚Ä¢	OpenAI Cookbook: Provides examples and guides for integrating GPTs with various APIs and services . 
	‚Ä¢	Community Repositories: GitHub repositories like bapo2/gpt-actions offer a collection of action schemas that can serve as references. 

If you need assistance transitioning from GPT Actions to these alternatives or have specific integration requirements, feel free to ask.

# Platform Strategy & UX

#### You:
<time datetime="2025-06-07T15:55:41.614Z" title="6/7/2025, 10:55:41 AM">10:55</time>


1. Core Platform: HelenKella.com
Non-conformative social network built on React/TypeScript + Node.js (deployed on Replit, Firebase Hosting & GCP)

Central login system with Google, Discord, Twitter OAuth + custom ID-based signup

Multi-environment CI/CD via GitHub Actions, secret management, caching & preview flows

2. Sub-Platform ‚ÄúHats‚Äù / Branches
Mysconduct

NSFW-friendly intimacy platform, consent-first interactions, creator monetization via subscriptions & ‚ÄúZines.‚Äù

Built-in camming/live sessions video chat site per branch.

The Satirium

Satirical content hub with gamification, community critique, and shock-value self-deprecation.

Mysmanaged

Branding & biz-strategy persona system handling growth, investor relations, and legal/financial ‚Äúhat‚Äù logic.

Whoracism

Crossover zone where Satirium and Mysconduct meet, blending satire, sexuality, and social critique (hidden beta).

Wholesome World (WholesomWhollyh)

Cozy, healing spin-off with neurodivergent safety and anti-perfectionist rituals (soft launch branch).

3. Infrastructure & Ops
Godmode execution pipelines (security, performance, engagement) as Cloud Functions + Firebase infra

API Hub‚Äîcentralized REST endpoints for all sub-platforms, automated Docusaurus developer docs

Cloudflare optimizations and supabase integration for backend services

4. Authentication & Security
OAuth integrations: Google, Discord, Twitter + bespoke ID verification codes

Screenshot prevention: auto-blackout + report + temporary freeze on unauthorized capture

Role-based access with ‚ÄúSluturgical Advisor,‚Äù ‚ÄúTrauma Tech Support,‚Äù etc., tied to Discord archetypes

5. Monetization & Payments
All-in-one subscription model for creators

Zine sales: weekly digital / monthly digital / quarterly physical

Shell payment option abstraction layer (CashApp, Ko-fi for now; crypto planned)

Grant & funding pipeline: Ko-fi, Kickstarter outreach, CashApp fundraising funnel

6. Onboarding & UX
Ritualized onboarding quiz: A/B archetype selection leading to role-feed personalization

Interactive dashboards: live feedback placeholders, roadmap & ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs next‚Äù showcase

Modular pages: hierarchy grids, carousels, accordions, collapsibles in Docusaurus site

7. AI Personas & Agents
Psychosexual model (‚ÄúLinguistic Kinks‚Äù Zine, intensity tagging, consent triggers)

Mysconduct & Mismanaged sub-agents for moderation, legal, financial, publishing logic

Dynamic AI pipeline: call-when-needed with timeouts; lightweight .NET Micro Framework prototypes

8. Community & Roles
Discord server roles themed as psychological archetypes (with emoji, lore, perks)

Onboarding prompts & self-identification questions for each role / archetype

Discord scraper bot (Option A) for message & member analytics

9. Documentation & Governance
Docusaurus living docs for platform spec, emotional-access UX, investor deck sources

Master binder markdown: investor structuring, security, prompting, builds

Compliance & harm-reduction guidelines embedded into UI and AI workflows

10. Roadmap & Launch Prep
Fundraising assets: pitch deck slides, grant proposals, landing page copy, social posts

Marketing funnel: ‚ÄúRequest Demo / Schedule a Call‚Äù CTAs via Calendly + Jitsi/Daily.io

Cross-platform campaigns targeting ADHD, addiction, neurodivergent communities on TikTok, Discord, Instagram

# Replit Bounty Hunting Guide

#### You:
so like replit bounty hunting etc 

#### ChatGPT:
Ah yes, bounty hunting on Replit ‚Äî digital mercenary mode. üí∏ Let‚Äôs break it down like you‚Äôre about to run a solo op in the wild west of web-based coding tasks:

---

### üîé What is Replit Bounty Hunting?

It‚Äôs essentially getting paid to solve code problems for others on [Replit Bounties](https://replit.com/bounties). Think of it as Fiverr-meets-GitHub, but for dev work. You:

- Browse open bounties.
- Pick ones you can crush.
- Submit a solution.
- Get paid if it‚Äôs accepted.

---

### üí• What You‚Äôll See on There

- **Mini full-stack builds**: Think ‚Äúbuild me a React calculator‚Äù or ‚Äúcreate an API that does X.‚Äù
- **Bots, scrapers, Discord integrations**
- **Fix-my-shit requests**: Bug fixing, logic corrections, or performance boosts.
- **Deploy-to-cloud support**: Firebase, Vercel, etc.
- **Beginner-friendly Bounties**: Dead simple CRUD stuff that still pays.

Some are quick $20-$50 hits. Some are $500+, depending on complexity and desperation of the requester.

---

### üõ† What You Need to Win

Let‚Äôs be blunt. Most bounties go fast and get swarmed. Here's what you *actually* need:

#### 1. **Fast, Flexible Stack Fluency**

You're already using:

- React
- Firebase
- Node.js
- Chakra UI
- Google Cloud

That‚Äôs golden. Add:

- Quick CLI + Git skills
- JSON wrangling
- Python (optional, but dominant in AI/data bounties)

#### 2. **Copy-Paste Kung Fu**

Reuse snippets, templates, even AI-generated scaffolds. Speed matters. Bounties are not for artisanal slow builds ‚Äî they‚Äôre for max value per keystroke.

#### 3. **Fast Response, Clean Commits**

Get in early, comment with *what you plan to do*, and back it up with a repo link or demo preview. Most requesters ghost anyone who doesn‚Äôt feel turnkey.

#### 4. **Your Own Templates + Starters**

Build your ‚Äústarter armory‚Äù: boilerplate for:

- React apps with Chakra + Firebase
- Discord bots
- Scraper templates
- REST/GraphQL APIs

---

### üß† Tactical Move: Use Godmode for Bounty Flow

Want to really dominate? Set up a Godmode pipeline to:

- Monitor new bounties via scraper
- Auto-rank by tech stack match + payout
- Create repo + basic README + deploy scaffold in one click
- Use AI to generate first pass at solution

Let me know if you want that built. It's wild how much time it saves.

---

### üëÄ Next Micro-Step

Want me to:

- Scrape current open bounties by keyword or skill?
- Build a bounty response boilerplate?
- Set up your bounty-hunting Godmode kit?
- Or draft a killer Replit profile that makes you look like an elite ghost coder?

Pick one and let‚Äôs full-send it.


#### You:
add in each and every possible thing i'll need

#### ChatGPT:
Alright, bounty hunter ‚Äî you want the **full kit**? No fluff, no filler. Here's **everything** you‚Äôll need to go from bounty nobody to *freelance killshot* in the Replit ecosystem (and beyond, since you can use this stack for other marketplaces too). This is **your tactical loadout**, Helen-style:

---

## üéØ **CORE MINDSET**

### 1. **Speed > Perfection**

- Done > Perfect
- Functional > Pretty
- Deliver something NOW, polish if they ask

### 2. **Automate the Boring Parts**

- Setup scripts
- Deploy pipelines
- Template folders
- AI assists

### 3. **Profile Like a Pro**

- You're not begging ‚Äî you‚Äôre the answer to their problem.

---

## üß∞ TECH STACK: *TOOLS YOU NEED ON DAY ONE*

| Category        | Tools                                                                  |
| --------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Code Editor     | [Replit](https://replit.com), [VS Code](https://code.visualstudio.com) |
| Version Control | Git, GitHub/GitLab, Replit's built-in Git integration                  |
| Frontend        | React.js, Chakra UI, Tailwind, basic HTML/CSS/JS                       |
| Backend         | Node.js, Express.js, Firebase Functions, Supabase                      |
| Databases       | Firebase Firestore, PostgreSQL, SQLite, MongoDB                        |
| DevOps          | Replit Deployments, GitHub Actions, Vercel, Netlify, Railway           |
| APIs & Auth     | OAuth (Google, Discord), REST, GraphQL, Firebase Auth                  |
| Scripting       | Bash, Python, JavaScript (for scraping, automating, botting)           |
| AI Helpers      | ChatGPT (obv), GitHub Copilot, Claude, Tabnine                         |

---

## üí£ GODMODE WORKFLOW STACK (REPLIT-OPTIMIZED)

1. **Prebuilt Templates Folder**
   - React App w/ Chakra + Auth
   - Firebase Function + API router
   - Discord bot scaffold
   - CRUD app boilerplate
   - Web scraper starter

2. **One-Click Deployment Configs**
   - Replit `.replit` file
   - `package.json` scripts
   - Firebase hosting setup
   - `.env.example` files

3. **Utility Scripts**
   - `init.sh` to bootstrap projects
   - `deploy.sh` for Firebase/Vercel
   - `start.sh` to run things locally

4. **Replit Extensions / Secrets**
   - Set up `REPLIT_DB_URL`, `TOKEN`, `API_KEY`, etc. securely
   - Use `.env` or Firebase/Cloud secrets

---

## üí∏ BUSINESS SIDE (TO GET PAID + LOOK LEGIT)

| Need               | Solution                                                                      |
| ------------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Payment processors | CashApp, Stripe, PayPal, Ko-fi, Wise, Revolut                                 |
| Invoice generator  | [Invoice Generator](https://invoice-generator.com/) or Notion template        |
| Portfolio site     | Replit or Firebase hosted; simple personal site w/ GitHub links & screenshots |
| Time tracking      | Clockify, Toggl (optional unless paid hourly)                                 |
| Task tracker       | Trello, Notion, or just GitHub issues                                         |
| Communication      | Email, Discord, Telegram (Replit often uses Discord)                          |

---

## üîê SECURITY & CREDIBILITY

- Use **GitHub** to version your work ‚Äî public if clean, private if messy
- Include a `README.md` with:
  - What it is
  - How to run it
  - What to do if it breaks
- Include `.env.example` for any secrets
- **Never** hardcode your tokens or keys. Set up environment variables.

---

## üß† PERSONAL SYSTEMS & WORKFLOWS

### Scripts to Build Now:

- `claim-bounty.sh` ‚Äì sets up repo, readme, .env, pushes to GitHub
- `setup-firebase.sh` ‚Äì sets up basic Firebase project
- `deploy-webhook.sh` ‚Äì auto deploy to Vercel/Firebase from CLI

### Templates to Store:

- Pitch templates (comment replies like "I can do this, here's my plan")
- Project proposal templates (for bigger bounties)
- Bugfix commit messages (clean, consistent style)
- Portfolio-ready screenshots + demo gifs

---

## üìà UPGRADE PATH

| Level | What to Add                   | Why                                                 |
| ----- | ----------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| 1     | Whisper API or TTS            | Add speech layers to apps or accessibility features |
| 2     | Puppeteer or Playwright       | Automate user testing or scraping tasks             |
| 3     | LLM integration (GPT, Claude) | Add ‚Äúmagic‚Äù to basic apps, bump perceived value     |
| 4     | Stripe integration            | For paid user flows or donation buttons             |
| 5     | Chrome Extensions             | Expand reach; many bounties ask for them            |

---

## üëë NEXT-MOVE REPLIT GODMODE PACK

If you want to **fully automate the bounty hunt**, here‚Äôs what I can set up next:

# üß± GODMODE: BOUNTY HUNTER STACK

## üì¶ LAYER 1: **Project Scaffolding System (Instant Start)**

### üîß Core Automations:

- `bounty-init.sh`:\
  **Auto-creates your folder, .env, README, and git repo with remote push.**
  ```bash
  #!/bin/bash
  mkdir "$1" && cd "$1"
  git init
  echo "# $1" > README.md
  echo -e ".env\nnode_modules\n.DS_Store" > .gitignore
  cp ~/Templates/env.example .env.example
  cp ~/Templates/index.js .
  git add . && git commit -m "init bounty setup"
  gh repo create "$1" --public --source=. --remote=origin --push
  code .
  ```

### üîÑ Optional Enhancers:

- Templated `.replit`, `package.json`, and `firebase.json`
- Auto-fill metadata from bounty listing via `bounty-scraper.js`

---

## üß† LAYER 2: **Smart Bounty Feed & Alert System**

### üì° `bounty-watchdog.js`:

- Scrapes [Replit Bounties](https://replit.com/bounties) every 10 min
- Filters by tag: `["Firebase", "React", "Automation", "Discord", "Bot"]`
- Scores by:
  - Price-to-effort ratio
  - Tech match (you predefine)
  - Time to deadline
- Sends push alert to:
  - Discord channel
  - Email
  - Local pop-up

> You wake up ‚Üí get a ping ‚Üí click ‚Üí it opens bounty + starts repo init.

### üí¨ `bounty-responder.py`

  Hey [name], this bounty fits my expertise perfectly. I‚Äôll deliver a working MVP within [time estimate], using [tech stack]. Here's a preview repo: [GitHub link].

  Demo: [replit.live or Firebase host]

  ```
- Pulls from:

Thanks for the full context. Here's a clear breakdown and guidance to transition your **Custom GPT projects that used GPT Actions** to **post-deprecation equivalents**, using what you've already built:

---

## üõ†Ô∏è **What You Had: GPT Actions**
You used:
- OpenAPI schemas (3.0 / 3.1)
- External API calls from GPTs
- Tasks like workflow triggering, data pulls, etc.

These are **now deprecated**.

---

## üîÑ **Transition Strategy: Use These Alternatives**

### 1. **Function Calling (within GPT-4o / Assistants API)**
**Use if:** You control the backend or want structured JSON execution from prompts.

‚úÖ *How it works*:
- Define functions (Python/JS or REST-callable)
- GPT returns arguments ‚Üí you call backend ‚Üí return output to GPT.

üì¶ **Your existing GPT Actions ‚Üí Convert into**:
```json
{
  "name": "getWeather",
  "description": "Get current weather for a city",
  "parameters": {
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
      "city": { "type": "string" }
    },
    "required": ["city"]
  }
}
```

**Then in code (e.g., Node.js or Firebase Function)**:
```js
async function getWeather({ city }) {
  const res = await fetch(`https://api.weatherapi.com/data/${city}`)
  return await res.json()
}
```

---

### 2. **OpenAI Assistants API**
**Use if:** You want persistent agents with memory + functions.

‚úÖ Ideal for **Godmode / Ritual agents / dashboard-based GPTs**

You can:
- Assign tools (functions, code interpreter, file uploads)
- Persist memory across sessions
- Integrate custom calls or tools

üìò [Assistants API Docs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/assistants/overview)

---

### 3. **Platformized Agent Hubs (Lindy, Cognosys, CrewAI)**
**Use if:** You want to chain multiple APIs/workflows or agents.

‚úÖ Best for:
- Task routing
- Chained GPT workflows (e.g., fetch ‚Üí analyze ‚Üí send)
- Serverless integration with Gmail, Notion, etc.

---

## üß∞ **Recommended Upgrade Path for You**

You‚Äôre running:
- Firebase/Functions
- GitHub Actions CI
- Modular agent architecture (Puzzle‚ÜíRitual router)
- Godmode execution layer

So:  
‚úÖ Use **Assistants API** for **modular agent logic**  
‚úÖ Use **Function calling + Cloud Functions** for **external API integrations**  
‚úÖ Build a **router (you already have this)** to invoke relevant actions.

---

## üß™ Convert Example: `triggerMap` (Old GPT Action ‚Üí New Function Call)

Old:
```yaml
GET /weather
parameters:
  - city: string
```

New:
```ts
// triggerMap.ts
export const triggerMap = {
  "get weather": {
    agent: "weatherBot",
    action: "getWeather",
  },
  ...
}
```

Then define the function JSON and handle it in `executeAgent()` using Firebase or Supabase.

---

If you want help migrating any specific GPT Action schema, upload it ‚Äî I‚Äôll convert it into:
- Function-calling spec
- Node.js execution logic
- Firebase Cloud Function wrapper

Or if you want an **Assistants API wrapper to replace Actions**, I‚Äôll scaffold it for you.

Alright. No fluff. Here's **how to actually use the OpenAI API** (specifically the new **Assistants API + Function Calling** system) and plug it into your Godmode stack.

---

# üö® THE BARE-NAKED TRUTH: OPENAI API BREAKDOWN

## üí° Concept Flow:
1. You **create an Assistant** (just like a GPT, but programmatic)
2. You **register functions** that it‚Äôs allowed to call
3. You **create a conversation thread**
4. You **send a message** from the user
5. OpenAI **runs the assistant**, decides what function to call
6. You **capture that function call**, run your code (e.g. fetch weather)
7. You **submit the result**, assistant continues
8. You **read the final output**

---

# üß∞ SETUP (ONCE)

## ‚úÖ 1. Install SDK

```bash
npm install openai
```

## ‚úÖ 2. Configure API client

```ts
// openaiClient.ts
import OpenAI from "openai"

export const openai = new OpenAI({
  apiKey: process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY
})
```

---

# üîß HOW TO USE IT ‚Äî STEP BY STEP

## üß™ STEP 1: Create an Assistant

```ts
const assistant = await openai.beta.assistants.create({
  name: "Weather Ritual",
  instructions: "You are a ritual assistant who gives mystical weather updates.",
  tools: [{ type: "function" }],
  model: "gpt-4-1106-preview",
  functions: [
    {
      name: "getWeather",
      description: "Get weather for a location",
      parameters: {
        type: "object",
        properties: {
          location: {
            type: "string",
            description: "City name"
          }
        },
        required: ["location"]
      }
    }
  ]
})
```

‚ò†Ô∏è This returns an `assistant.id` you save.

---

## üì© STEP 2: Create a Thread

```ts
const thread = await openai.beta.threads.create()
```

---

## üßô‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è STEP 3: Add a Message

```ts
await openai.beta.threads.messages.create(thread.id, {
  role: "user",
  content: "What's the weather in Tokyo?"
})
```

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è STEP 4: Run the Assistant

```ts
const run = await openai.beta.threads.runs.create(thread.id, {
  assistant_id: "asst-abc123" // your assistant ID
})
```

Now you **poll the run status**:

```ts
let runStatus = await openai.beta.threads.runs.retrieve(thread.id, run.id)

while (runStatus.status === "in_progress") {
  await new Promise(r => setTimeout(r, 1000))

# ‚öôÔ∏è GODMODE RITUAL EXTRACTION SYSTEM  
> _Notebook ‚Üí Function Schema ‚Üí TriggerMap ‚Üí Assistant Execution ‚Üí Lore Realization_

---

## üß± Structure

| Layer | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `notebook-dump.txt` | Raw ritual inputs, fragments, chaos scribbles |
| `extract-rituals.mjs` | Minimal script to send that notebook to your local LLM |
| `triggerMap.json` | Extracted function calls, clean + routable |
| Assistants API | Calls functions based on this map |
| Firebase / Godmode OS | Hosts the execution router and agents |

---

## üîÆ Ritual Format in Notebook (Expected Inputs)

```md
üïØÔ∏è Ritual: summon-lore  
Intent: Generate a lore fragment for a given archetype  
Params:  
- archetype: string  
Returns: Markdown string
```

```md
üíÄ Ritual: trigger-banishment  
Intent: Ban a cursed entity from a dimension  
Params:  
- entity_id: string  
- dimension: string  
Returns: confirmation object
```

---

## üß† Prompt Template: `extract.triggerMap`

```txt
You are an extraction module. Given a notebook dump with embedded rituals and archetypes, extract a flat triggerMap in JSON format.

Format:
{
  "summon-lore": {
    "function": "generateLoreDrop",
    "parameters": {
      "archetype": "Whoracism"
    }
  }
}
Only extract entries that contain clear trigger names or emoji markers.
```

---

## ‚ö° Starter Script: `extract-rituals.mjs`

```js
import fs from 'fs'
const notebookText = fs.readFileSync('./notebook-dump.txt', 'utf-8')

const response = await fetch('http://localhost:11434/api/generate', {
  method: 'POST',
  headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
  body: JSON.stringify({
    prompt: basePrompt + notebookText,
    model: 'gpt4',
    stream: false
  })
})

const result = await response.json()
fs.writeFileSync('./triggerMap.json', JSON.stringify(JSON.parse(result.response), null, 2))
```

---

## üß™ Output Example: `triggerMap.json`

```json
{
  "summon-lore": {
    "function": "generateLoreDrop",
    "parameters": {
      "archetype": "Whoracism"
    }
  },
  "trigger-banishment": {
    "function": "banishEntity",
    "parameters": {
      "entity_id": "string",
      "dimension": "string"
    }
  }
}
```

---

## üßô Assistant Flow (OpenAI Assistants API)

```ts
await openai.beta.threads.messages.create(thread.id, {
  role: "user",
  content: "Trigger: summon-lore",
  function_call: {
    name: "generateLoreDrop",
    arguments: JSON.stringify({ archetype: "Whoracism" })
  }
})
```

---

## üîÅ Firebase Ritual Router (puzzleRouter.ts)

```ts
const input = req.body.input.toLowerCase()
const match = triggerMap[input]
const result = await executeAgent(match.assistant_id, match.function, req.body.userId, match.parameters)
```

---

## üî• Ritual Dev Loop

```bash

# Extract function map
node extract-rituals.mjs

# Sync to Firebase / router
firebase deploy --only functions:puzzleRouter

import zipfile
import os

# Define paths
zip_path = "/mnt/data/chatgpt-export-markdown-3.zip"
extract_dir = "/mnt/data/chatgpt_exported_md"

# Extract the ZIP file
with zipfile.ZipFile(zip_path, 'r') as zip_ref:
    zip_ref.extractall(extract_dir)

# List the extracted files
extracted_files = []
for root, dirs, files in os.walk(extract_dir):
    for file in files:
        extracted_files.append(os.path.join(root, file))

extracted_files[:10]  # Show the first 10 for preview

import zipfile
import os

# Define paths
zip_path = "/mnt/data/chatgpt-export-markdown-3.zip"
extract_dir = "/mnt/data/chatgpt_exported_md"

# Extract the ZIP file
with zipfile.ZipFile(zip_path, 'r') as zip_ref:
    zip_ref.extractall(extract_dir)

# List the extracted files
extracted_files = []
for root, dirs, files in os.walk(extract_dir):
    for file in files:
        extracted_files.append(os.path.join(root, file))

extracted_files[:10]  # Show the first 10 for preview

# Load and concatenate all markdown files into a single notebook-style text blob for ritual extraction
notebook_text_blob = ""

for file_path in extracted_files:
    if file_path.endswith(".md"):
        with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as file:
            notebook_text_blob += f"\n\n---\n\n# {os.path.basename(file_path)}\n\n"
            notebook_text_blob += file.read()

# Save it as a unified dump for extraction
unified_path = "/mnt/data/notebook-dump-from-zip.md"
with open(unified_path, "w", encoding="utf-8") as f:
    f.write(notebook_text_blob)

unified_path

content.text:
# Retry using 'latin1' fallback for files with encoding issues
notebook_text_blob = ""

for file_path in extracted_files:
    if file_path.endswith(".md"):
        try:
            with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as file:
                content = file.read()
        except UnicodeDecodeError:
            with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='latin1') as file:
                content = file.read()

        notebook_text_blob += f"\n\n---\n\n# {os.path.basename(file_path)}\n\n"
        notebook_text_blob += content

# Save final dump
unified_path = "/mnt/data/notebook-dump-from-zip.md"
with open(unified_path, "w", encoding="utf-8") as f:
    f.write(notebook_text_blob)

unified_path

content.text:
# Load the unified notebook dump for extraction
with open(unified_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as file:
    notebook_dump = file.read()

# Define a simple pattern-based extractor for ritual trigger definitions
import re
import json

# Pattern to extract entries like:
# üïØÔ∏è Ritual: trigger-name
# Intent: something
# Params: - key: type
ritual_pattern = re.compile(
    r"Ritual:\s*([a-zA-Z0-9\-_]+).*?Intent:\s*(.*?)\s+Params:\s*((?:- .*?\n)+)",
    re.DOTALL
)

# Extract rituals
rituals = ritual_pattern.findall(notebook_dump)

# Convert to triggerMap-style dictionary
trigger_map = {}

for name, intent, raw_params in rituals:
    param_lines = raw_params.strip().split('\n')
    param_dict = {}
    for line in param_lines:
        if ':' in line:
            key, val = line.strip('- ').split(':', 1)
            param_dict[key.strip()] = val.strip()

    trigger_map[name] = {
        "function": f"{name.replace('-', '_')}",
        "parameters": param_dict
    }

# Save to JSON
trigger_map_path = "/mnt/data/triggerMap.json"
with open(trigger_map_path, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
    json.dump(trigger_map, f, indent=2)

trigger_map_path

# Define a simple pattern-based extractor for ritual trigger definitions
import re
import json

# Pattern to extract entries like:
# üïØÔ∏è Ritual: trigger-name
# Intent: something
# Params: - key: type
ritual_pattern = re.compile(
    r"Ritual:\s*([a-zA-Z0-9\-_]+).*?Intent:\s*(.*?)\s+Params:\s*((?:- .*?\n)+)",
    re.DOTALL
)

# Extract rituals
rituals = ritual_pattern.findall(notebook_dump)

# Convert to triggerMap-style dictionary
trigger_map = {}

for name, intent, raw_params in rituals:
    param_lines = raw_params.strip().split('\n')
    param_dict = {}
    for line in param_lines:
        if ':' in line:
            key, val = line.strip('- ').split(':', 1)
            param_dict[key.strip()] = val.strip()

    trigger_map[name] = {
        "function": f"{name.replace('-', '_')}",
        "parameters": param_dict
    }

# Save to JSON
trigger_map_path = "/mnt/data/triggerMap.json"
with open(trigger_map_path, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
    json.dump(trigger_map, f, indent=2)
